Entourage differently Here\'s how to take part in the Entourage project, if there are no events or actions in your region: Make a financial donation to\nEntourage Devenir reporter pour\nEntourage Talk about Entourage Become an Ambassador LinkedOut program I help Entourage in a different way I modify my area of ​​action C\It\'s pretty quiet here Search\nfurther
To help with the future deployment of Entourage in your region, be our eyes and ears! Share with us what you observe in your environment.\n\nThis questionnaire covers different themes, answer them as much as you can. If the situation changes, you can fill it out again to keep us informed.\n\nYour collaboration is precious, we thank you warmly! The Entourage reporters Participate

Welcome to the \nsocial network, truly social For many, the street is a place of passage.\nFor some, c\'is a daily life.\nSo to start, meet those who live it every day. Find our awareness contentici
C\It\'s time to get started! A social network, c\, is better with several people!\nIntroduce yourself to %s A social network, c\'is better with several people!\nIntroduce yourself to your group %s Introduce yourself to your group of neighbors Some tips for getting to know each other: Give your first name, your city Talk about your passions Highlight your needs and desires Need d\ inspiration? Say hello to my neighbors Hello Parisian neighbors. My name m\ is Eric and j\ I look forward to meeting you at entourage network events.
Up to you How about d\, a little quiz to deconstruct prejudices about the world of the street? In your opinion, what percentage of homeless people have a cell phone? Start the quiz
10 days already: welcome to the family! C\It\'s crazy how quickly time flies when you\'re in good company.\n\nNow help us grow the Entourage network: bring yours! Share the \ app
Discover the events 6,000 people made new friends at an Entourage event Give your neighbors a helping hand No d\ help around you? Create it! Find the \ event that interests you and come and enjoy a friendly moment. Take a look at the requests published near you: A good way to create links between neighbors is to share your interests, your passions or just a coffee to get to know each other. Discuss over a coffee Donation of women\'s clothing 10m from me Paris (75010) June 21, 2022 at 12 p.m. Discover the events Discover requests Create a contribution “Discover the \ Entourage app, the truly social social network”

Introduce yourself to network members Good morning ! I have just joined the network and I would like to meet some caring neighbors. To enter your description, access your profile from the <font color="#ec4e1a">profile</font> button at the bottom right
Explore the initiatives around youentourages Consult the actions created by your neighbors and <font color="#ec4e1a">join those that interest you from the map</font>
Dare to meet homeless people <font color="#ec4e1a">Discover the practical advice</font> of the <font color="#ec4e1a">Simple Comme Bonjour</font> guide from the profile at the bottom right
Launch a solidarity action Call on your neighbors to help surround a homeless person. <font color="#ec4e1a">Create an action with the button:</font>
The rule Group rules, read carefully. Attitude Exchanges in groups must take place with respect, trust and mutual assistance between members so that everyone can feel safe and in a warm environment. It is therefore not permitted to make degrading, aggressive, insulting, discriminatory, insistent, intolerant or defamatory comments. Trade The groups are spaces for exchange and mutual aid between neighbors, advertising is therefore prohibited, as are proposals for purchase, sale or rental. Jackpot Generally speaking, there is no money relationship between the members of the groups, prize pools are prohibited. Topics Benevolent free expression is the rule on groups. However, to respect the apolitical and secular nature of Entourage and in the interest of protecting people, subjects relating to politics, religion, medical or sexuality are not authorized. Protection of people Publications cannot contain any personal data allowing a person to be precisely identified and located nor any sensitive data about people (medical, judicial, ethical origin, sexual or political orientation data, etc.).
Charter of events Charter of events, read carefully. Be kind I use the application for the purpose of mutual aid for people in very precarious or excluded situations. Collect agreement I ensure the consent of the people concerned before creating an action. Ensuring the protection of people I guarantee not to communicate sensitive personal data (medical, legal, etc.), or allowing the precise identification or location of people. Be united, without distinction I undertake to make no distinction as to race, color, sex, language, religion, political opinion, property, birth or any other status.
Code of ethics
Mutual aid The application allows you to create new meetings between neighbors and encourage times of exchange. Remote assistance (drive, delivery, gift voucher, prize pool, etc.) is not authorized. Contributions & requests I can ask for or offer material goods (equipment, clothing, etc.), services (laundry, printing of documents, etc.) and sharing times (coffee, activity, etc.). I cannot request or offer financial assistance, accommodation or food assistance. But if I need it, I can contact the moderator who will guide me. Consent When I post a request for a third party, I make sure to obtain their consent beforehand. No discrimination I undertake to enter into relationships with people without discrimination (race, religion, sexual orientation, political opinion, etc.). Protection of people I guarantee that my actions do not contain any personal data (last name, telephone number, precise address, etc.), allowing a person to be precisely identified and located, nor any sensitive data (medical, legal, etc.).

Audience Private You accept that anyone participates in your event, without checking their profile first. You validate each person individually before confirming that they can participate.
Your action is public, everyone can participate freely. Your action is private, you will have the choice to accept or refuse any person requesting to participate.

Request help Call the network Suggest help Donate something, time, etc. Announce an event on a specific date
CATEGORY I LOOK FOR… I PROPOSE TO…
TITLE Example: I am available for administrative assistance for access to housing Actions with a clear title attract more members and are more likely to succeed! Your title must be less than 100 characters. You can say more in the description. Example: Game evening between neighbors with and without homes Events with a clear title attract more participants.
DESCRIPTION Example: I am a former town hall employee and available for administrative assistance in accessing housing.\nIf you think you need help, we can meet in a café on the weekend. Tell your story. Actions with a clear description attract more members and are more likely to succeed! Example: Need for volunteers for the national Restos du Cœur collection in our local team You can modify this description and the date of your event at any time.

It looks like c\ is calm here!<br/><br/> Move the map to find support structures: solidarity restaurants, public showers, medical centers open to street people…<br/><br /> A structure is missing on the map?<br/> <a href=\'%1$s\'>Suggest a structure</a> <br/><br/>The Municipal Social Action Center in your municipality can provide you with information on all the local associations and social assistance available to residents.
The Solidarity Guide allows you to find out about support structures: solidarity restaurants, public showers, medical centers open to street people...\n\n As a local resident, you can suggest a place to a street person, but keep in mind that it is the role of social workers to support each situation.
